Row.Text: Out from nowhere rides a stranger. What will come of this, nobody can say.
I am very pleased to have come here, to this place, and to have met you.
Hello. I am very happy that we have all gathered here, in this place. I, Chief Crowfoot, am a lover of peace. But know this: we Blackfoot are fierce enemies.
Even the fiercest of warriors cannot always win.
At least the land will know peace again. Such cannot be said for us, however.
What is life? It is the flash of a firefly in the night. It is the breath of a buffalo in the wintertime. It is the little shadow which runs across the grass and loses itself in the sunset.
It is good that we have all come together again.
Hello. How is everything at your end of the world?
Very good to see you again.
A pleasant morning to you.
It is good to be here.
You?
Not good.
We should pursue peace together, instead of the path of war that you seem so fixed upon.
Have you come to seek peace? I warn you, we are very accomplished on the battlefield.

Our people are very brave. My warriors have enjoyed the fact that your army is sitting on our borders, since they have gained much honor and pride by pranking and playing with them. But if they don't leave, eventually someone is going to get killed. And, since the Blackfoot are such great combatants, it will probably be your men. Withdraw immediately, so that we can have peace.
The Blackfoot do their best to live in harmony with our land. But how can we if you keep taking it all and exploiting it? This is not the path to peace.
I am very happy about this request.
This is almost perfect!

It would be very beneficial to open our lands to each other. We would love a greater world to explore and gain honor in, while you could, maybe, do something with our land. Have you ever thought of massive railways?
